short_text: Provide a cited reference library of model railroading specifications and standards across target scales (N, HO, S, O, G, Z, TT).
Provide calculators to convert real-world measurements by selected model scale with documented rounding rules.
Publish guidance for automation and scenery as structured, cited checklists.
Provide basic navigation and search to locate specs and guides.
Provide local/network-limited real-time layout control (e.g., throttle, turnout/route actions) on documented interfaces.
Provide DCC CV read/write in service and ops modes with audit logging.
Provide import/export for at least one track-plan format and enable a basic virtual operating session.
At launch, publish ≥20 cited specification entries across target scales.
A named specification is discoverable in ≤3 clicks from the landing page.
Scale conversion outputs match hand-checked results within documented rounding rules.
Display prominent safety cautions and require explicit user acknowledgement before enabling live control.
V1 excludes cloud-hosted remote operations; restrict to local/network-limited scope.
Honor content licensing and attributions; each value cites source name, version, and date.
Standards usage rights/licensing may restrict reproduction
Scope creep into tools/forums dilutes schedule
Security exposure if remote control expands
